conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_A. Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery, and I would be very happy to accept a place if offered. I’m applying formally and can confirm we’re ready to commit promptly if accepted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Apply immediately to my top choice, Nursery_B. Although Nursery_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further if higher-priority parents apply first. A direct, sincere application may help if others choose different first options or are rejected elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Parent_A, thank you very much for your application and for sharing that Nursery_B is your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re not able to offer you a place at Nursery_B at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your nursery allocation.
conversation.thought: My true priority list is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received applications from A, B, C, and D. Since quota is 1 and I can only accept one, I should reserve the spot for the highest-priority applicant among those available. Parent_B is ranked above Parent_A, and Parent_B also lists Nursery_B as their 2nd choice (after Nursery_A), so there is some risk they may be accepted by Nursery_A; however, I also have strong applicants C and D who rank above A, so accepting A now would lock in my lowest-ranked option among current applicants. Given the simultaneous presence of higher-priority applicants, I should reject Parent_A.
